code:
# Magic Dedicated Wallet Microsoft Social Login

Please [click here](https://magic.link/docs/authentication/features/social-logins/social-providers/microsoft) for full implementation instructions
explanation: This block is a dedicated wallet for Microsoft Social Login, allowing users to authenticate with their Microsoft account credentials.
repository_explanation:
Here's a concise summary:

**Repository:** `magiclabs/microsoft-oauth-demo`
**Purpose:** Demonstration of Microsoft OAuth authentication flow using Node.js.
**Content:** Example code, configuration files, and documentation for implementing MS OAuth in a web application.
file_summary:
Here is a concise and to-the-point holistic summary:

**README.md:**

A dedicated Microsoft Social Login wallet enabling secure authentication with Microsoft account credentials.

code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8" />
    <link rel="icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />
    <meta name="theme-color" content="#000000" />
    <meta
      name="description"
      content="Web site created using create-react-app"
    />
    <link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/logo192.png" />
    <!--
      manifest.json provides metadata used when your web app is installed on a
      user's mobile device or desktop. See https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/web-app-manifest/
    -->
    <link rel="manifest" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/manifest.json" />
    <!--
      Notice the use of %PUBLIC_URL% in the tags above.
      It will be replaced with the URL of the `public` folder during the build.
      Only files inside the `public` folder can be referenced from the HTML.

      Unlike "/favicon.ico" or "favicon.ico", "%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico" will
explanation:

explanation:
This block is a web manifest file, defining settings for a PWA (Progressive Web App). It specifies:

* Name and short name
* Icon sizes and types
* Startup URL
* Display mode (standalone)
* Color schemes (#000000 theme color, #ffffff background color)

explanation:

**Importing Google Fonts, Defining Global Styles**

This code imports a font from Google Fonts (Inter) and sets global styles for HTML, body, and container elements, including font sizes, line heights, margins, and text alignments. It also defines specific styles for headers, buttons, images, and loading messages within the application.

explanation:
**Summary:** This block defines two CSS styles for HTML elements:

* The first style centers an item horizontally and sets a bottom margin.
* The second style (`.user-info`) sets a fixed width, left text alignment, background color, margins, padding, border radius, and horizontal scroll overflow for a specific HTML element.

explanation:
Here is a concise summary:

**Purpose:** Dashboard component that handles user authentication and logout functionality.

**Functionality:**

* Retrieves user data from social login using Magic OAuth
* Displays loading message until user data is retrieved
* Displays user data in JSON format once authenticated
* Allows user to log out and redirect back to home page.

file_summary:
Here is a concise summary of the file 'src/pages/Dashboard.js':

**Purpose:** Handles user authentication and logout functionality.

**Key Features:**

* Authenticates users with social login (Magic OAuth)
* Displays user data in JSON format
* Allows users to log out and redirect back home.

explanation: This line exports a component named "Dashboard" as the default export, making it available for use elsewhere in the application.

explanation:
**Purpose:** To facilitate social login using Microsoft credentials.

**Functionality:** A React component that redirects users to Microsoft for authentication, upon successful completion redirecting them to a specified dashboard page.

"Handles social login with Microsoft credentials, redirecting users through MS authentication and then to a designated dashboard page upon successful login."
